concept.title: Selecting a Diploma Name at NC State University
concept.shortdesc: Understand the options for choosing a Diploma Name at NC State University, which appears on diplomas and official commencement materials.

conbody.p: NC State University provides students the flexibility to choose a Diploma Name that differs from their legal name. This name appears on the official diploma and in commencement materials, reflecting a student's identity as they prefer it to be recognized.

section.title: Options for Diploma Names
section.p: The Diploma Name can include various personalization options to suit different preferences and cultural practices:

ul.li: Use of first name, initial, or a preferred version (e.g., Mike instead of Michael).
Exclusion of the legal first name when using a middle name as the primary name.
Adjustments to the middle name, such as using an initial or excluding it entirely.
Inclusion of former or maiden names and culturally specific surnames.
Application of proper capitalization and accent marks.

section.title: Considerations for Diploma Names
section.p: When choosing a Diploma Name, consider the following:

ul.li: Diploma names must be reviewed for appropriateness; inappropriate uses may be rejected.
For degree verification, third parties may encounter difficulties if there is a mismatch between the preferred and legal names.
International students and those entering professional fields should consider the implications of name discrepancies on legal and professional documents.

section.title: Impact on Official Records
section.p: Once selected, changing the Diploma Name post-graduation may require ordering and paying for a replacement diploma. Such changes are subject to deadlines and university policies.
